data.question: What is the chemical formula of the soft porous material discussed?
What unique property does the material [Zn(L)2(OH)2]n·Guest exhibit under hydrostatic pressure?
Can the magnitude of NAC in [Zn(L)2(OH)2]n·Guest be tuned?
data.answer: Yes, by exchanging guests adsorbed from hydrostatic fluids.

data.question: Is the NAC effect observed in [Zn(L)2(OH)2]n·Guest reversible?
What are the guest molecules mentioned for [Zn(L)2(OH)2]n·Guest?
What hydrostatic fluids were used to investigate the NAC effect in [Zn(L)2(OH)2]n·Guest?
data.answer: Silicone oil, methanol-ethanol mixture, and isopropanol

data.question: Does the crystal structure of [Zn(L)2(OH)2]n·Guest change under pressure?
data.answer: Yes, it undergoes structural changes under pressure.

data.question: What is the role of guest molecules in the NAC effect of [Zn(L)2(OH)2]n·Guest?
data.answer: Guest molecules interacting with the voids affect the distortions of the framework and contribute to the NAC effect.

data.question: What is the highest pressure mentioned in the experiments with [Zn(L)2(OH)2]n·Guest?
Is the NAC effect in [Zn(L)2(OH)2]n·Guest the same in all hydrostatic fluids used?
data.answer: No, the NAC effect varies with different hydrostatic fluids.

data.question: What structural feature of [Zn(L)2(OH)2]n·Guest contributes to its NAC effect?
data.answer: The interplay of flexible [−Zn–O­(H)−]n helices with layers of [−Zn–L−]4 quadrangular puckered rings.

data.question: What potential applications are mentioned for materials with NAC like [Zn(L)2(OH)2]n·Guest?
Was the NAC effect in [Zn(L)2(OH)2]n·Guest directly measured or theoretically predicted?
What is the significance of the dihedral angle φ in the structure of [Zn(L)2(OH)2]n·Guest?
data.answer: The dihedral angle φ indicates the puckering of quadrangular rings, which is related to the NAC effect.

data.question: How does the presence of isopropanol affect the NAC of [Zn(L)2(OH)2]n·Guest?
data.answer: Isopropanol molecules block the width contraction of the pores, affecting the volume compression and contributing to the NAC effect.

data.question: What is the role of the [−Zn–O­(H)−]n helices in the structure of [Zn(L)2(OH)2]n·Guest?
data.answer: The compression of these helices contributes to the NAC effect by affecting the framework's mechanical strain.

data.question: Does the NAC effect in [Zn(L)2(OH)2]n·Guest depend on the size of the guest molecules?
What is the crystal system of [Zn(L)2(OH)2]n·Guest?
What is the space group of [Zn(L)2(OH)2]n·Guest?
Are the phenylene rings in the structure of [Zn(L)2(OH)2]n·Guest ordered or disordered?
